required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quantification of Prosthesis Penetration With Conebeam in Otosclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: Early Postoperative Imaging of the Labyrinth by Cone Beam CT After Stapes Surgery for Otosclerosis With Correlation to Audiovestibular Outcome

brief_summary.textblock:
Sensorineural complications of stapes surgery are rare but potentially serious. Imaging is usually performed to identify an underlying cause, such as excessive intravestibular penetration of the prosthesis or pneumolabyrinth suggesting perilymphatic fistula.
Unfortunately, there is very little data in an unselected series of uneventful patients.
The aim of this study is to analyze the depth of prosthesis penetration within the vestibule and the rate of pneumolabyrinth the day or the day after the procedure by performing a Cone Beam CT (CBCT) of the temporal bone in a cohort of unselected patients, and to correlate imaging findings to clinical outcome. This prospective monocentric study is conducted in a tertiary referral medical center. A CBCT is performed in 80 consecutive patients having undergone stapes surgery for otosclerosis, the day or the day after the procedure. Penetration length and location of the prosthesis within the vestibule, as well as presence or absence of a pneumolabyrinth are recorded, and compared to clinical data (vertigo, nystagmus, hearing measurement).

primary_outcome.measure: location of the medial tip of the prosthesis within the vestibule
change in pure-tone bone conduction hearing thresholds
primary_outcome.time_frame: between baseline and 1 day after surgery
7 days, 1 month and 3 months after surgery
7 days, 1 month and 3 months after surgery
baseline, 1 month and 3 months after surgery
primary_outcome.description: audiometry: Speech Discrimination Score at a standard presentation level of 60 decibels (SDS60) expressed in percentages

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 1 month and 3 months after surgery
primary_outcome.description: audiometry: Speech Reception Threshold at 50% (SRT50) and/or 100% (SRT100) expressed in dB

study_pop.textblock: patients undergoing stapes surgery for otosclerosis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age >= 18 years old
- patients undergoing stapes surgery for otosclerosis
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient's refusal to participate in the study
- patient under legal protection
- no medical insurance coverage
- pregnant or breast feeding patient

results_reference.citation: Vandevoorde A, Williams MT, Ukkola-Pons E, Daval M, Ayache D. Early Postoperative Imaging of the Labyrinth by Cone Beam CT After Stapes Surgery for Otosclerosis With Correlation to Audiovestibular Outcome. Otol Neurotol. 2017 Feb;38(2):168-172. doi: 10.1097/MAO.0000000000001306.
